reviews.title: A bloody fantastic Shanghai base for a family!

reviews.text: Our bags were whisked away as soon as they hit the kerb. The greeting at reception was lovely, professional and warm. But we really loved Lee the concierge/bell hop. Although we only stayed two nights, he greeted me with a beaming "Hello Mr Nick!" ever time he saw me he also wrote down the address of a great market (cheap bags, electronics and software) in Chinese for a cab driver.

reviews.text: We went for a 3 bedroom suite and it was massive. God help whoever has to clean this place! Lovely full kitchen and laundry, stunning views of the city from 3 angles and wonderful beds sent from heaven. The bathrooms were immaculate and beautiful.

reviews.text: The Verdict
reviews.title: Home feel

reviews.text: Located in the new Pudong area, it's at very close proximity to Line 2 and Line 9 metros as well as ex-tallest buildings of the world, Shanghai Financial Center (Bottle opener is what they call it locally!) and Oriental Pearl Tower. This apartment offers everything and in a luxurious fashion. Rooms are very intelligently done so as to provide the sense of airiness while accommodating all the necessary items for the stay. For the pure vegetarian, it is difficult in Shanghai and hence the completely furnished kitchen was a big big help. While the cost is on the higher side, it is worth it. Remember to carry washing powder and shampoo (hotel one does not suit me!) along with you as it will be difficult to find in the nearby 7x11 stores. Wifi was not available in the room until the last day of checkout. As mentioned by other reviewers, there is no restaurant in the hotel. But the Pudong road by the side of the hotel has lots of restaurants including McDonald's, KFC, Pizza Hut etc. Breakfast can be quite boring as there are the same varieties everyday.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.title: Holy cow--what a deal! Why stay at a 'regular' hotel?

reviews.text: I was in a group of 8 persons and had booked this Executive Apartment after reading some generally positive reviews about it in TripAdvisor. My advice to all other travellers is - beware and be sure before you book an apartment in this property.
reviews.title: Large Apartments, Poor Service and Maintenance

reviews.text: Firstly, the positives - location is generally good in a safe and modern part of Shanghai in the Pudong district, so if you are in Shanghai for work in that area, and want a large apartment, this could indeed be a good choice for you. As mentioned, the apartments are very large and generally clean. I got a two bedroom apartment which was over 120 square metres in floor area. Unfortunately, the positives end here.
reviews.title: Great Location, Close to #2 subway line

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived, to our surprise, the rooms were not adequately prepared. There were insufficient towels (we expected at least one towel per person, but there were only 3 towels per apartment!) and only one bathrobe per apartment. There were also insufficient toiletries to go around. To make things much worse, the air-conditioning was not working! This was completely unsatisfactory as we were not informed prior to our arrival. It simply reflects the generally poor standard of the hotel management. One thing which they are very good at though is collecting money upfront on most things. The GM tried his best to explain that the air-conditioning was linked to the adjacent building and that it was undergoing some form of maintenance, but how could we sleep without air-conditioning in warm weather? The windows were rather small.
reviews.title: Spacious apartments

reviews.text: Breakfast was very limited in terms of choices of food. Average quality. The breakfast room was also very warm!
reviews.title: Extremely Unprofessional and Terrible Living

reviews.text: So after just 2 days / nights, we decided to move out of the apartment despite the fact that we were supposed to stay for 7 days / nights.
